observation: I can see a residence selection page with a country/region dropdown that shows 'Select'. There's a 'Next' button below it, and I can see 'Already have an account? Log in' text at the bottom. There appear to be some language selection overlays open on the page. I need to close these overlays first and then select a country from the dropdown to proceed with the sign-up flow.
reasoning: As a normal user, I need to close the language selection overlays that are blocking the main interface before I can interact with the country selection dropdown. The close button (X) is visible in the top right of one of the overlays.
ux_issues: Language selection overlays are blocking the main signup interface
Multiple overlapping UI elements create confusion

outcome.visual_observation: The language selection overlay was closed and the main sign-up flow progressed. The background image changed from a person on stairs to coins with trading symbols (Bitcoin, Apple, USD, etc.), and the heading changed from 'Trading for anyone. Anywhere. Anytime.' to 'Trade Gold, Crypto, Forex, Oil, and more.' The pagination indicators at the bottom also updated to show progression through the onboarding flow.

console_logs: [warning] The resource https://fonts.gstatic.com/s/inter/v19/UcCo3FwrK3iLTcviYwYZ8UA3.woff2 was preloaded using link preload but not used within a few seconds from the window's load event. Please make sure it has an appropriate `as` value and it is preloaded intentionally.
